title: How Cheap ‘Fast Furniture’ Could Soon Clog Landfills
description: The mass-produced furniture that sold furiously during the pandemic could soon be clogging landfills.
dc:creator: Debra Kamin
media:credit: John Taggart for The New York Times.
media:description: Consumers spent $4 billion from 2019 to 2021 on furniture in the United States. Environmentalists say that a lot of the products sold during the pandemic weren’t built to last.
